intro: Eremostachys fetisowii, commonly known as the Tibetan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, arid environments and often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in alpine meadows. Eremostachys fetisowii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
